summary: This is the official transcript of the teleconference arraignment, initial scheduling conference, and bail hearing for Ghislaine Maxwell before Judge Alison J. Nathan on July 14, 2020. The defendant pleads not guilty to the superseding indictment. The government argues for pretrial detention based on extreme risk of flight, citing Maxwell's financial resources, international ties, and alleged efforts to conceal herself. Defense counsel argues for release on strict conditions. Judge Nathan orders Maxwell detained pending trial, finding the government met its burden to show she is a flight risk and no conditions could reasonably assure her appearance.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused in the case, charged with conspiracy to transport minors for unlawful sexual activity, enticement of minors to travel to engage in unlawful sexual activity, and perjury. She pleads not guilty and her counsel argues for bail.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Presiding judge over the arraignment, scheduling conference, and bail hearing. She rules on procedural matters and ultimately orders Maxwell detained pending trial.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Lead defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell from Cohen & Gresser, LLP. He argues for her release on bail with strict conditions and responds to the government's allegations.

persons.name: Christian R. Everdell
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell from Cohen & Gresser, LLP, appearing alongside Mark Cohen.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell from Haddon Morgan & Foreman, P.C., appearing alongside Mark Cohen.

persons.name: Laura A. Menninger
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell from Haddon Morgan & Foreman, P.C., appearing alongside Mark Cohen.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, whose office is prosecuting the case.

persons.name: Leah Harmon
persons.context: Pretrial Services Officer who participates in the hearing, having prepared a report on the defendant.

persons.name: Kristen Carannante
persons.context: Court reporter for the Southern District of New York who is on the line for the proceeding.

persons.name: Annie Farmer
persons.context: An alleged victim who addresses the court by her true name, stating Maxwell groomed and abused her when she was 16 and arguing Maxwell is a flight risk.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier and alleged co-conspirator. The indictment alleges Maxwell groomed minors for sexual abuse by Epstein. His prior investigation and non-prosecution agreement are discussed.

persons.name: Scott Marshall
persons.context: An alias allegedly used by a person involved in purchasing the New Hampshire property where Maxwell was arrested. Described as having a British accent and claiming to be retired from the British military.

persons.name: Janet Marshall
persons.context: An alias allegedly used by Ghislaine Maxwell, according to a real estate agent, during the purchase of a New Hampshire property. Described as having a British accent and claiming to be a journalist.

connections.description: The indictment alleges Maxwell participated in a conspiracy with Epstein to sexually exploit minors, grooming and transporting girls for abuse by him.
Mark Cohen is lead defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell, representing her at the arraignment and bail hearing.
Annie Farmer states she met Maxwell when she was 16 and that Maxwell groomed and abused her.
Christian Everdell is defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell from Cohen & Gresser.
Jeffrey Pagliuca is defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell from Haddon Morgan & Foreman, P.C.
Laura Menninger is defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell from Haddon Morgan & Foreman, P.C.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested by law enforcement at a property in New Hampshire.

events.title: Arraignment and Bail Hearing
events.description: Teleconference proceeding for Ghislaine Maxwell's arraignment on a superseding indictment, scheduling conference, and bail hearing. She pleads not guilty. Judge Nathan orders her detained pending trial.

events.title: Scheduled Trial Date
events.description: Trial is scheduled to commence on this date, as set during the scheduling conference.

events.title: Purchase of New Hampshire Property
events.description: A property in New Hampshire was purchased, allegedly by individuals using the aliases Scott and Janet Marshall, who the government contends included Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: Southern District of New York (court jurisdiction)
New Hampshire (property where Maxwell was arrested)
United Kingdom (location of property owned by Maxwell)
Southern District of Florida (location of prior Epstein investigation files)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell pleaded not guilty to charges including conspiracy to transport minors for unlawful sexual activity and perjury.

The government argued for detention based solely on risk of flight, citing Maxwell's significant financial resources, multiple foreign citizenships (France, UK, US), lack of stable US ties, and alleged year-long effort to conceal her whereabouts.

Judge Alison J. Nathan ordered Maxwell detained pending trial, finding the government proved by a preponderance of the evidence that she was a flight risk and no combination of conditions could reasonably assure her appearance.
Two alleged victims, including Annie Farmer, addressed the court during the bail hearing, describing abuse by Maxwell and supporting detention.

The government revealed new allegations during the hearing, including that Maxwell used an alias ('Janet Marshall') to purchase a New Hampshire property and that a cell phone was found wrapped in foil at the arrest location.
